snippet: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria fighters pose a direct threat to the pro-Iranian government of Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, vowing to massacre Shiites and destroy their shrines.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Iran once had a critical ally in Iraq, after American military removed Sunni dictator Saddam Hussein and helped Iran-friendly Shiites to consolidate power there; situation for Iran is darker now, as Islamic State in Iraq and Syria pose direct threat to pro-Iranian government of Prime Min Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, and are now promising to massacre Shiites and destroy their shrines in Najaf and Karbala, compelling Iran to intervene.
lead_paragraph: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria fighters pose a direct threat to the pro-Iranian government of Prime Minister Nuri Kamal al-Maliki, vowing to massacre Shiites and destroy their shrines.
